title: Taylor Quits Frontbench, Russia Targets Telegram, Guthrie Abduction | 10 News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News - Angus Taylor quits the Coalition frontbench ahead of an expected leadership challenge, 10 people are dead after one of Canada’s worst mass shootings, chilling details emerge from the investigation into Nancy Guthrie’s suspected abduction, Victoria Police prepare for a major security operation in Melbourne ahead of Israeli President Isaac Herzog’s controversial visit, two Chinese nationals are accused of spying on a Canberra Buddhist group, and Russia intensifies restrictions on the messaging app Telegram. title: Canada Shooting: Police Name Suspect Who Killed 9 In British Columbia School Massacre | 10 News
description: An 18-year-old woman has been identified as the gunman behind a mass shooting in Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia, that left nine people dead before she took her own life.  Police say Jesse Van Rootselaar fatally shot her mother and stepbrother at home before killing a teacher and four students at a local school.  Authorities confirmed she had a history of mental health concerns and had previous contact with police, but say it is too early to determine a motive.  Prime Minister Mark Carney called the attack a “very difficult day for the nation”, ordered flags flown at half-mast, and urged Canadians to come together as the nation mourns one of its deadliest shootings. title: Gunman Arrested After Two Injured In Thailand School Shooting | 10 News
description: At least two people have been injured after a gunman opened fire at a public high school in southern Thailand and briefly took people hostage on Wednesday.  A 17-year-old man entered Phatong Prathan Keeriwat School near the city of Hat Yai shortly before 5pm with police later confirming that the suspect surrendered after a two-hour standoff and was taken into custody.  The school principal and a female student were taken to hospital with a gunshot wound, while another student was injured after jumping off the building in panic.  Officials are still investigating the motive for the attack. title: Pam Bondi Explodes At Epstein Files Hearing | 10 News
description: Survivors of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking ring, on Wednesday, condemned the US Department of Justice's handling of the Epstein files after victims’ names were published and alleged abusers were redacted.  US Attorney General Pam Bondi attempted to defend her department’s handling of the files, but the exchange became heated, accusing congresspeople of engaging in “theatrics” when inviting her to apologise to victims present at the hearing.  Lawmakers have expressed frustration and anger at the amount of material in the Epstein files which has been redacted or withheld. Trump administration personnel has cited legal privileges as the reason for doing so. title: Does Australia Get More Tax From Beer Than Gas?
description: Do Australians pay more tax on beer than international gas companies pay on the Australian offshore gas they export?  During a Senate Estimates hearing on Thursday, Independent Senator David Pocock asked Treasury Deputy Secretary Shane Johnson to compare the estimated income from the excise on beer to the estimated profits from PRRT (petroleum resource rent tax), exposing that Australian beer drinkers pay an estimated $1.2b more on tax than large corporations do on offshore gas processing.  The PRRT was introduced in 1988 to ensure Australians benefit from the oil and gas extracted from Australian land. However, gas companies have exploited loopholes to avoid the tax by understating the value of the gas they sell.  Beer drinkers and producers in Australia face some of the highest tax rates in the world, with consumers paying over $20 in tax per slab of full-strength beer sold at bottle shops. title: Man Detained In Nancy Guthrie Case Reportedly Released | 10 News
description: Arizona police have reportedly released a man they previously detained in relation to the abduction of Nancy Guthrie.  The released man, who told reporters his name was "Carlos," said he was mistakenly arrested and has "no idea" what led authorities to his door.  "I didn't do anything. I mean, I hope they get the suspect. Because I'm not it," he said outside his house on Wednesday, February 11.  Authorities have not confirmed why they arrested the released man in the first place, however speculation claims it was a case of mistaken identity.  84-year-old Nancy Guthrie, mother of US television host Savannah Guthrie, is believed to have been kidnapped from her home on January 31. title: Dawson’s Creek Star James Van Der Beek Dies Aged 48 | 10 News
description: 90s heartthrob James Van Der Beek has died only 48-years-old.  The star of Dawson's Creek passed away peacefully this morning two years after revealing he'd been diagnosed with stage three colorectal cancer.   He leaves behind his wife and six children.
